3 bed detached house for sale

West Kington, Chippenham, Wiltshire SN14

Offers over

£700,000

Agent information View Agent profile

Knight Frank - Bath Sales

Agent address,
4 Wood Street, Bath, BA1 2JQ

Call 01225 616272

Property details

  • 3 bedrooms

Features

  • 3 bedrooms
  • 2 reception rooms
  • 2 bathrooms
  • Period
  • Garden
  • Private parking
  • 0.48 acres

Listing view statistics

Last 30 days: 1450 page views

Since listed: 1450 page views

Description

For sale, Martins' Nest is a unique and beautiful house that combines considerable charm and character from the original building, with the contemporary extension providing superb accommodation for modern day living.

The original part of the house is constructed of traditional stone elevations under a slate tiled roof with pretty gothic windows to the front elevation. Adjacent to the original house is a stunning contemporary addition with glazed windows to the front and a sedum green roof. The two elements of the building combine exceptionally well to provide a striking facade and well planned accommodation. On the ground floor is the living room with stone fireplace and wood burner; which enjoys a beautiful outlook from the two gothic arched windows and door that leads to the garden. The kitchen/dining room provides an exceptional open plan space with glazed doors to the front which make the most of the magnificent position and views. Off the kitchen is a useful larder cupboard. Also on the ground floor is a snug/tv room, utility room and a modern bathroom.

On the first floor is a master bedroom with en suite shower room, and a door leading out onto a fantastic roof garden where the views over the village and surrounding countryside are at their best. There are two further bedrooms on this floor.

The property is approached via a private driveway that leads to the parking area. The house is surrounded by beautiful gardens, mainly laid to lawn edged with well stocked flower borders. There is a terrace immediately to the front of the house that provides an excellent outdoor dining space. A gate from the garden joins a path that leads down into the village.

In all approximately 0.48 of an acre.

Martins' Nest is a beautiful detached country house occupying a secluded position overlooking the picturesque village of West Kington, an area of Outstanding Natural Beauty. It is a highly desirable Cotswold village due to the sought after combination of having superb communications links whilst remaining rural, peaceful and undisturbed. The village comprises a hamlet and a church but there is a thriving community and excellent pubs, village shops and schools nearby in Acton Turville and Marsheld. Chippenham provides a comprehensive range of shopping facilities meeting all day to day needs, whilst the City of Bath, a cultural hub in the region provides first class shopping, restaurants and leisure facilities.

The property is well placed for commuting with easy access to both J 17 & 18 of the M4 which link to London.

M4 (Junction 18 (Junction 18) 3 miles, Marshfield 4 miles, Chippenham 9 miles Bath 10 miles, Tetbury 13.5 miles, Bristol 17.5 miles (all distances are approximate).

Water costs explained

Water consumption is based on average water usage for the predicted occupancy of the property based on the number of bedrooms.
Total annual consumption (in cubic meters) is then averaged into a monthly cost.
Note: If you have 2 separate suppliers for water and sewage, you may receive 2 separate bills.

Council tax

Close dialog
Estimated cost

£278 per month

When paid over 10 months

The breakdown

  • Council tax band G £278 per month

    Wiltshire

Council tax explained

The Council Tax cost displayed is based on the council tax band and on the basis of 2 adults living at the property. The monthly cost shown excludes any discounts and is rounded to the nearest pound.
Full information on Council Tax discount entitlements can be found on the Gov.UK's website.
